summary.span: Controls the system garbage collector, a service that automatically reclaims unused memory.

span.span: Controls the system garbage collector, a service that automatically reclaims unused memory.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 垃圾回收器控制的分配和释放的托管内存的公共语言运行时组件。The garbage collector is a common language runtime component that controls the allocation and release of managed memory. 此类中的方法影响在对象上并释放资源对象分配了执行垃圾回收时。The methods in this class influence when garbage collection is performed on an object and when resources allocated by an object are released. 此类中的属性提供有关可用的内存总量信息在系统和年龄类别中或生成，分配给对象的内存。Properties in this class provide information about the total amount of memory available in the system and the age category, or generation, of memory allocated to an object. 垃圾回收器跟踪并回收托管内存中分配的对象。The garbage collector tracks and reclaims objects allocated in managed memory. 定期，垃圾回收器执行垃圾回收回收内存分配给没有有效的引用的对象。Periodically, the garbage collector performs garbage collection to reclaim memory allocated to objects for which there are no valid references. 当无法满足内存要求，使用可用的可用内存，垃圾回收时会自动发生。Garbage collection happens automatically when a request for memory cannot be satisfied using available free memory. 或者，应用程序可以强制使用垃圾收集方法。Alternatively, an application can force garbage collection using the method. 垃圾回收包含以下步骤：Garbage collection consists of the following steps: 1. 垃圾回收器搜索的托管代码中引用的托管对象。The garbage collector searches for managed objects that are referenced in managed code. 2. 垃圾回收器尝试完成未引用的对象。The garbage collector tries to finalize objects that are not referenced. 3. 垃圾回收器释放未引用的对象，并回收其内存。The garbage collector frees objects that are not referenced and reclaims their memory. 本主题包括以下部分：This topic includes the following sections: [垃圾回收器和非托管的资源](#unmanaged) [The garbage collector and unmanaged resources](#unmanaged) [对象老化和代](#generations) [Object aging and generations](#generations) [不允许垃圾回收Disallowing garbage collection](#NoGCRegion) ## 垃圾回收器和非托管的资源The garbage collector and unmanaged resources 在回收中，垃圾回收器将不会释放对象如果在托管代码中找到对对象的一个或多个引用。During a collection, the garbage collector will not free an object if it finds one or more references to the object in managed code. 但是，垃圾回收器不能识别对一个对象从非托管代码的引用，并且可能会释放正在使用非托管代码中以独占方式除非明确禁止执行此操作的对象。However, the garbage collector does not recognize references to an object from unmanaged code, and might free objects that are being used exclusively in unmanaged code unless explicitly prevented from doing so. 方法提供了一种机制，防止垃圾回收器收集中非托管代码仍在使用的对象。The method provides a mechanism that prevents the garbage collector from collecting objects that are still in use in unmanaged code. 除了托管的内存分配，垃圾回收器的实现不维护有关对象，如文件句柄或数据库连接保持的资源的信息。Aside from managed memory allocations, implementations of the garbage collector do not maintain information about resources held by an object, such as file handles or database connections. 当类型使用该类型的实例进行回收之前，必须释放的非托管的资源时，该类型可以实现终结器。When a type uses unmanaged resources that must be released before instances of the type are reclaimed, the type can implement a finalizer. 在大多数情况下，终结器实现的重写方法; 但是，在 C# 或 c + + 编写的类型实现析构函数，哪些编译器将转换为的重写。In most cases, finalizers are implemented by overriding the method; however, types written in C# or C++ implement destructors, which compilers turn into an override of . 在大多数情况下，如果对象具有终结器中，垃圾回收器调用它之前释放该对象。In most cases, if an object has a finalizer, the garbage collector calls it prior to freeing the object. 但是，垃圾回收器不需要在所有情况下; 调用终结器例如，方法显式阻止调用对象的终结器。However, the garbage collector is not required to call finalizers in all situations; for example, the method explicitly prevents an object's finalizer from being called. 此外，垃圾回收器不需要使用一个特定的线程来完成对象，或确保用于相互引用，而是可用于垃圾回收的对象调用终结器的顺序。Also, the garbage collector is not required to use a specific thread to finalize objects, or guarantee the order in which finalizers are called for objects that reference each other but are otherwise available for garbage collection. 在资源必须释放在特定时间的情况下，类可以实现接口，其中包含执行资源管理和清理任务的方法。In scenarios where resources must be released at a specific time, classes can implement the interface, which contains the method that performs resource management and cleanup tasks. 类实现必须指定为它们的类协定中，如果类使用者调用方法，以清理该对象。Classes that implement must specify, as part of their class contract, if and when class consumers call the method to clean up the object. 垃圾回收器不会默认情况下，调用方法; 但是，实现方法可以调用方法类自定义垃圾回收器的终止行为。The garbage collector does not, by default, call the method; however, implementations of the method can call methods in the class to customize the finalization behavior of the garbage collector. 对象终止和的释放模式的详细信息，请参阅[清洗向上非托管资源](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)。For more information on object finalization and the dispose pattern, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md). ## 对象老化和代Object aging and generations 公共语言运行时在垃圾回收器支持使用代的对象期限。The garbage collector in the common language runtime supports object aging using generations. 代次是一个内存中的对象的相对时间度量单位。A generation is a unit of measure of the relative age of objects in memory. 生成编号或的对象的保留时间指示属于对象的代。The generation number, or age, of an object indicates the generation to which an object belongs. 创建多个对象最近是一部分较新的代，并且具有较低的生成编号不是对象创建前面的应用程序生命周期。Objects created more recently are part of newer generations, and have lower generation numbers than objects created earlier in the application life cycle. 在最新生成的对象是第 0 代中。Objects in the most recent generation are in generation 0. 此实现的垃圾回收器支持的对象的三代、 第 0、 1 和 2。This implementation of the garbage collector supports three generations of objects, generations 0, 1, and 2. 你可以检索的值属性来确定系统支持的最大代数。You can retrieve the value of the property to determine the maximum generation number supported by the system. 对象老化允许在一组特定的代，而无需需垃圾回收器评估所有代上的应用程序迁移到目标垃圾回收。Object aging allows applications to target garbage collection at a specific set of generations rather than requiring the garbage collector to evaluate all generations. 重载的方法包括`generation`参数允许你指定最后一代进行垃圾回收。Overloads of the method that include a `generation` parameter allow you to specify the oldest generation to be garbage collected. ## 不允许垃圾回收Disallowing garbage collection 从开始[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]，垃圾回收器支持无 GC 区域延迟模式，可以在垃圾回收如何产生负面影响应用的性能的关键路径执行期间使用。Starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)], the garbage collector supports a no GC region latency mode that can be used during the execution of critical paths in which garbage collection can adversely affect an app's performance. 无 GC 区域延迟模式要求您指定可由垃圾回收器不受干扰分配的内存量。The no GC region latency mode requires that you specify an amount of memory that can be allocated without interference from the garbage collector. 如果运行时可以分配的内存，运行时将不会执行垃圾回收，在关键路径中的代码执行时。If the runtime can allocate that memory, the runtime will not perform a garbage collection while code in the critical path is executing. 通过调用的重载之一定义的无 GC 区域的关键路径的开头。You define the beginning of the critical path of the no GC region by calling one of the overloads of the . 通过调用中指定其关键路径的末尾方法。You specify the end of its critical path by calling the method. 无法将调用传给方法，并且你应只调用方法如果运行时当前处于无 GC 区域延迟模式。You cannot nest calls to the method, and you should only call the method if the runtime is currently in no GC region latency mode. 换而言之，不应调用多次 （在第一个方法调用后，后续调用将不会成功），并且不应需要调用成功只是因为第一次调用到成功。In other words, you should not call multiple times (after the first method call, subsequent calls will not succeed), and you should not expect calls to to succeed just because the first call to succeeded. ## Examples 下面的示例使用多个 GC 方法以获取生成和有关未使用的对象的块的内存信息并将其打印到控制台。The following example uses several GC methods to get generation and memory information about a block of unused objects and print it to the console. 然后收集未使用的对象，并显示生成的内存总量。The unused objects are then collected, and the resulting memory totals are displayed. [!code-cpp[System.GC.Collect Int Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.gc.collect int example/CPP/class1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.GC.Collect Int Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.gc.collect int example/CS/class1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.GC.Collect Int Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.gc.collect int example/VB/class1.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 确定何时安排垃圾回收时，运行时将考虑在内分配托管的内存量。In determining when to schedule garbage collection, the runtime takes into account how much managed memory is allocated. 如果一个小的托管的对象分配大量的非托管内存，运行时仅托管的内存，将考虑在内，从而低估安排垃圾回收的紧急性。If a small managed object allocates a large amount of unmanaged memory, the runtime takes into account only the managed memory, and thus underestimates the urgency of scheduling garbage collection. 方法通知运行时在系统内存此额外的压力。The method informs the runtime of this additional pressure on system memory. 在最简单的使用情况模式中，托管的对象分配构造函数中的非托管的内存和释放在`Dispose`或`Finalize`方法。In the simplest usage pattern, a managed object allocates unmanaged memory in the constructor and releases it in the `Dispose` or `Finalize` method. 调用方法之后分配非托管的内存中，并调用方法之后将其释放。Call the method after allocating the unmanaged memory, and call the method after releasing it. 在更复杂的情况下，其中的非托管的内存分配非常大的变化的托管对象的生存期内，可以调用和方法进行通信的运行时对这些增量更改。In more complicated scenarios, where the unmanaged memory allocation changes substantially during the lifetime of the managed object, you can call the and methods to communicate these incremental changes to the runtime. > [!CAUTION] > 你必须确保删除完全您添加的压力量。You must ensure that you remove exactly the amount of pressure you add. 如果不这样做可能会较长时间的时间运行的应用程序中的系统的性能产生负面影响。Failing to do so can adversely affect the performance of the system in applications that run for long periods of time.

summary.span: Forces an immediate garbage collection of all generations.

span.span: Forces an immediate garbage collection of all generations.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用此方法来尝试回收不可访问的全部内存。Use this method to try to reclaim all memory that is inaccessible. 它执行阻碍性垃圾回收对所有代。It performs a blocking garbage collection of all generations. 所有对象，而不考虑多长时间已在内存中，被都视为集合;但是，不收集托管代码中引用的对象。All objects, regardless of how long they have been in memory, are considered for collection; however, objects that are referenced in managed code are not collected. 此方法用于强制系统尝试回收最大可用内存量。Use this method to force the system to try to reclaim the maximum amount of available memory. 从开始[!INCLUDE[net_v451](~/includes/net-v451-md.md)]，您可以通过设置压缩大型对象堆 (LOH)属性之前调用方法，如下面的示例演示。Starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v451](~/includes/net-v451-md.md)], you can compact the large object heap (LOH) by setting the property to before calling the method, as the following example illustrates. [!code-csharp[System.Runtime.GCSettings#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.runtime.gcsettings/cs/lohcompactionmode1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Runtime.GCSettings#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.runtime.gcsettings/vb/lohcompactionmode1.vb#1)] ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用方法以在每一代的内存上执行回收。The following example demonstrates how to use the method to perform a collection on all generations of memory. 代码生成未使用的对象，一个数字，然后调用方法以从内存中清除它们。The code generates a number of unused objects, and then calls the method to clean them from memory. [!code-cpp[System.GC.Collect Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.GC.Collect Example/CPP/class1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.GC.Collect Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.GC.Collect Example/CS/class1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.GC.Collect Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.GC.Collect Example/VB/class1.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用此方法来尝试回收不可访问的内存。Use this method to try to reclaim memory that is inaccessible. 但是，使用此方法不保证回收指定的代中的所有无法访问内存。However, using this method does not guarantee that all inaccessible memory in the specified generation is reclaimed. 如果实现对象老化时，垃圾回收器不会回收对象生成编号大于指定的代。If object aging is implemented, the garbage collector does not collect objects with a generation number that is higher than the specified generation. 如果未实现对象老化，垃圾回收器将在垃圾回收期间考虑的所有对象。If object aging is not implemented, the garbage collector considers all objects during the garbage collection. 使用属性来确定的最大有效值`generation`参数。Use the property to determine the maximum valid value of the `generation` parameter. 要考虑所有对象，而不管其代垃圾回收器，请使用此方法不采用参数的版本。To have the garbage collector consider all objects regardless of their generation, use the version of this method that takes no parameters. 具有垃圾回收器回收对象基于设置，请使用方法重载。To have the garbage collector reclaim objects based on a setting, use the method overload. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用方法以执行回收的内存的各个层上。The following example demonstrates how to use the method to perform a collection on individual layers of memory. 代码生成未使用的对象，一个数字，然后调用方法以从内存中清除它们。The code generates a number of unused objects, and then calls the method to clean them from memory. remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用`mode`参数来指定是否垃圾回收应该立即进行还是仅时间是否最佳若要回收对象。Use the `mode` parameter to specify whether garbage collection should occur immediately or only if the time is optimal to reclaim objects. 使用此方法不保证回收指定的代中的所有无法访问内存。Using this method does not guarantee that all inaccessible memory in the specified generation is reclaimed. 若要调整你的应用程序中重要期间垃圾回收的侵入性，设置属性。To adjust the intrusiveness of garbage collection during critical periods in your application, set the property. 垃圾回收器不会回收对象超过指定的更高版本生成编号`generation`参数。The garbage collector does not collect objects with a generation number higher than specified by the `generation` parameter. 使用属性来确定的最大有效值`generation`。Use the property to determine the maximum valid value of `generation`. 要考虑所有对象，而不管其代垃圾回收器，请使用此方法不采用参数的版本。To have the garbage collector consider all objects regardless of their generation, use the version of this method that takes no parameters. 若要让垃圾回收器回收到指定的代中的对象的对象，请使用方法重载。To have the garbage collector reclaim objects up to a specified generation of objects, use the method overload. 指定最大代数，将收集所有对象。When you specify the maximum generation, all objects are collected. ## Examples 下面的示例强制的第 2 代对象进行垃圾回收设置。The following example forces a garbage collection for generation 2 objects with the setting. remarks.format: ## Remarks 下表总结了`mode`和`blocking`参数：The following table summarizes the interaction of the `mode` and `blocking` parameters: |`mode`|`blocking` 为 `true``blocking` is `true`|`blocking` 为 `false``blocking` is `false`| |-|-|-| | 或 or |尽快执行阻塞回收。A blocking collection is performed as soon as possible. 如果后台回收正在进行和`generation`为 0 或 1，方法立即触发阻碍性回收，并在回收完成时返回。If a background collection is in progress and `generation` is 0 or 1, the method immediately triggers a blocking collection and returns when the collection is finished. 如果后台回收正在进行和`generation`为 2，方法等待后台回收完成，触发阻止第 2 代回收，然后返回。If a background collection is in progress and `generation` is 2, the method waits until the background collection is finished, triggers a blocking generation 2 collection, and then returns.|尽快执行回收。A collection is performed as soon as possible. 方法请求执行后台回收，但这并没有保证；阻止式回收仍可执行，具体视环境而定。The method requests a background collection, but this is not guaranteed; depending on the circumstances, a blocking collection may still be performed. 如果后台回收正在进行，该方法将立即返回。If a background collection is already in progress, the method returns immediately.| ||可能会执行阻止式回收，具体视垃圾回收器的状态和 `generation` 参数而定。A blocking collection may be performed, depending on the state of the garbage collector and the `generation` parameter. 垃圾回收器会尽量提供最佳性能。The garbage collector tries to provide optimal performance.|根据垃圾回收器的状态，有时可执行回收。A collection may be performed, depending on the state of the garbage collector. 方法请求执行后台回收，但这并没有保证；阻止式回收仍可执行，具体视环境而定。The method requests a background collection, but this is not guaranteed; depending on the circumstances, a blocking collection may still be performed. 垃圾回收器会尽量提供最佳性能。The garbage collector tries to provide optimal performance. 如果后台回收正在进行，该方法将立即返回。If a background collection is already in progress, the method returns immediately.| 如果调用方法执行完整的阻碍性垃圾回收时，你还可以通过设置压缩大型对象堆属性之前调用方法。If a call to the method performs a full blocking garbage collection, you can also compact the large object heap by setting the property to before calling the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果`blocking`是`false`，GC 决定是否执行后台或阻碍性垃圾回收。If `blocking` is `false`, the GC decides whether to perform a background or a blocking garbage collection. 如果`compacting`是`true`，它执行阻碍性垃圾回收。If `compacting` is `true`, it performs a blocking garbage collection. 如果`compacting`是`true`，运行时压缩小对象堆 (SOH)。If `compacting` is `true`, the runtime compacts the small object heap (SOH). 除非不会压缩大型对象堆 (LOH)属性设置为。The large object heap (LOH) is not compacted unless the property is set to . 请注意，这包括所有阻止垃圾回收，不只是完全阻止垃圾回收。Note that this includes all blocking garbage collections, not just full blocking garbage collections. 你可以调用方法来减少托管的堆大小可能的最小，如下面的代码段所示。You can call the method to reduce the managed heap to the smallest size possible, as the following code fragment illustrates. [!code-csharp[System.GC.Collect#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.gc.collect/cs/collect4.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.GC.Collect#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.gc.collect/vb/collect4.vb#1)] 指定`true`为`compacting`自变量可保证压缩、 完整的阻碍性垃圾回收。Specifying `true` for the `compacting` argument guarantees a compacting, full blocking garbage collection. 设置属性可确保压缩的 LOH 和 SOH。Setting the property to ensures that both the LOH and SOH are compacted.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 用途方法是确保会遇到正在过早地垃圾回收器回收对象的引用是否存在。The purpose of the method is to ensure the existence of a reference to an object that is at risk of being prematurely reclaimed by the garbage collector. 一个常见的方案，可能发生这种情况是当在托管的代码或数据，没有对对象的引用，但仍在使用的对象处于非托管代码如 Win32 Api，非托管 Dll，或者使用 COM 的方法A common scenario where this might happen is when there are no references to the object in managed code or data, but the object is still in use in unmanaged code such as Win32 APIs, unmanaged DLLs, or methods using COM. 此方法引用`obj`参数，从而使该对象再次进行垃圾回收从例程开始到点，按执行顺序调用此方法。This method references the `obj` parameter, making that object ineligible for garbage collection from the start of the routine to the point, in execution order, where this method is called. 在结束时，不范围的开始处，说明进行操作，此方法的代码其中`obj`必须可用。Code this method at the end, not the beginning, of the range of instructions where `obj` must be available. 方法不执行任何操作并不生成扩展中作为参数传递的对象的生存期以外的任何副作用。The method performs no operation and produces no side effects other than extending the lifetime of the object passed in as a parameter. ## Examples 下面的代码示例的开始处创建一个其`Main`方法并不是指该对象再次之前结束时，当调用方法。The following code example creates an object at the beginning of its `Main` method and does not refer to the object again until the end, when the method is called. 对象仍然存在持续时间 30 秒的`Main`方法，即使调用和方法。The object persists for the 30-second duration of the `Main` method, despite calls to the and methods. [!code-cpp[System.GC.KeepAlive Example2#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.GC.KeepAlive Example2/CPP/gckeepalive.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.GC.KeepAlive Example2#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.GC.KeepAlive Example2/CS/gckeepalive.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.GC.KeepAlive Example2#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.GC.KeepAlive Example2/VB/gckeepalive.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 生成编号或年龄，对象是对象的生命周期的实现定义的相对度量。The generation number, or age, of an object is an implementation-defined relative measure of an object's lifespan. 最新创建的对象是第 0 代中，最旧的对象是小于或等于生成返回级别属性。The most recently created objects are in generation 0 and the oldest objects are in a generation less than or equal to the generation returned by the property. 垃圾回收器假定较新的内存是更有可能适合于较旧的内存比垃圾回收。The garbage collector assumes that newer memory is more likely to be eligible for garbage collection than older memory. 因此，垃圾回收器可以提高其性能通过调整它回收内存，每次的世代号和属性值可以随时间增长。Therefore, the garbage collector improves its performance by adjusting generation numbers each time it reclaims memory, and the property value can grow over time. 如果实现对象老化，属性返回系统使用的最大代数; 否则，此属性返回零。If object aging is implemented, the property returns the maximum generation number used by the system; otherwise, this property returns zero. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何 MaxGeneration 属性用于在使用中当前显示的最大代数。The following example demonstrates how to use the MaxGeneration property to display the largest generation number currently in use. [!code-cpp[System.GC.Collect Int Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.gc.collect int example/CPP/class1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.GC.Collect Int Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.gc.collect int example/CS/class1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.GC.Collect Int Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.gc.collect int example/VB/class1.vb#1)]

span.para: 对于此实现，返回的值属性一定正在执行的应用程序的生存期内保持不变。使用属性来确定在调用时可以指定的最大值采用生成参数的方法。

For this implementation, the value returned by the property is guaranteed to remain constant for the lifetime of an executing application. Use the property to determine the maximum value you can specify when calling the method that takes a generation parameter.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 为每一代垃圾回收器设置到该代的分配阈值。For each generation, the garbage collector sets a threshold for allocations into that generation. 分配的大小超过此阈值，将该代上触发垃圾回收。When the size of allocations exceeds this threshold, a garbage collection is triggered on that generation. 有关示例中，如果生成 2 的阈值为 20 MB （这意味着 20 MB 存在第 1 代集合和提升到第 2 代），超过 20 MB 后仍存在第 1 代和提示到第 2 代，将尝试下一个垃圾回收作为第 2 代回收。For example, if generation 2’s threshold is 20MB (which means that 20MB survives generation 1 collections and is promoted into generation 2), and more than 20MB has survived generation 1 and is prompted into generation 2, the next garbage collection will be attempted as a generation 2 collection. 同样，如果大型对象堆 (LOH) 的阈值为 20 MB 和你的应用程序已经分配了多个 20 MB 的大型对象下, 一次垃圾回收将还尝试为第 2 代回收 （因为 gen2 垃圾回收中，才会收集 LOH）。Similarly, if the large object heap's (LOH's) threshold is 20MB and your app has allocated more than 20MB of large objects, the next garbage collection will also be attempted as a generation 2 collection (since the LOH is only collected in gen2 garbage collections). `maxGenerationThreshold`和`largeObjectHeapThreshold`阈值控制你多少提前通知完整的垃圾回收发生前。The `maxGenerationThreshold` and `largeObjectHeapThreshold` thresholds control how much in advance you are notified before a full garbage collection occurs. 阈值越大，之间通知和下一次完整的垃圾回收可能发生的多个分配。The greater the threshold, the more allocations that can occur between notification and the next full garbage collection. 如果必须由公共语言运行库的完整垃圾回收会对你的应用程序性能产生负面影响的情况下，你可以要求时运行时即将会进行完整的垃圾回收和绕过该集合由通知自行引发集合 (使用方法) 仍有利条件时。If you have situations in which a full garbage collection by the common language runtime would adversely affect your application's performance, you can ask to be notified when the runtime is about to do a full garbage collection and circumvent that collection by inducing a collection yourself (using the method) when conditions are still favorable. 除了更改自己的垃圾收集计划，完整 GC 通知适合以下方案中：In addition to changing the garbage collection schedule yourself, full GC notification is useful in following the scenarios: - 有关完整的垃圾回收的方法监视，并当系统通知你该正在接近，减小实时数据的大小 （例如，通过释放某些缓存条目）。You monitor for the approach of a full garbage collection and, when you are notified that one is approaching, you reduce live data size (for example, by releasing some cache entries). 因此，当垃圾回收发生时，它就可以以回收更多内存。As a result, when the garbage collection occurs, it is able to reclaim more memory. - 你的监视器的完整垃圾回收完成，以便你可以收集一些统计信息。You monitor for the completion of a full garbage collection so that you can collect some statistics. 例如，你可能想要度量在 GC 完成堆的大小，以便你了解实时数据的大小。For example, you might want to measure the size of the heap at GC completion so that you know the size of live data. （完整 GC，堆后在其最小大小。）(After a full GC, the heap is at its smallest size.) 有关什么表示完整的垃圾回收的详细信息，请参阅[垃圾回收通知](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/notifications.md)。For more information about what represents a full garbage collection, see [Garbage Collection Notifications](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/notifications.md). 当你注册垃圾回收通知时，通知您可以接近完整垃圾回收时，完成后。When you register for a garbage collection notification, you can be notified when a full garbage collection is approaching and when it is completed. 此模式类似于操作系统如何监视低内存通知。This pattern resembles how the operating system monitors for low memory notifications. 使用以下准则来指定`maxGenerationThreshold`和`largeObjectHeapThreshold`参数：Use the following guidelines for specifying the `maxGenerationThreshold` and `largeObjectHeapThreshold` parameters: - 阈值值越大，更多的分配将发生之间的通知和完整垃圾回收。The larger the threshold value, the more allocations will occur between the notification and the full garbage collection. 更大的阈值值提供更多运行时便会检查接近集合的机会。A larger threshold value provides more opportunities for the runtime to check for an approaching collection. 这会增加将通知您的可能性。This increases the likelihood that you will be notified. 但是，因为那样会导致多个分配运行时引发的下次回收之前，不应设置过高的阈值。However, you should not set the threshold too high because that results in a more allocations before the runtime induces the next collection. 当你自己引发回收收到通知使用较高阈值的值后时，不是运行时的下一次回收将回收进行回收更少的对象。When you induce a collection yourself upon notification using a high threshold value, fewer objects are reclaimed than would be reclaimed by the runtime's next collection. - 越小阈值、 通知和完整垃圾回收之间的更少分配。The smaller the threshold value, the fewer the allocations between notification and the full garbage collection. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何注册垃圾回收通知并启动的线程来监视垃圾回收通知的状态。The following example shows how to register a garbage collection notification and start a thread to monitor the status of the garbage collection notification. 此代码示例摘自更大的示例为提供[垃圾回收通知](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/notifications.md)主题。This code example is part of a larger example provided for [Garbage Collection Notifications](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/notifications.md) topic. remarks.format: ## Remarks 确定何时安排垃圾回收时，运行时将考虑在内分配托管的内存量。In determining when to schedule garbage collection, the runtime takes into account how much managed memory is allocated. 如果一个小的托管的对象分配大量的非托管内存，运行时仅托管的内存，将考虑在内，从而低估安排垃圾回收的紧急性。If a small managed object allocates a large amount of unmanaged memory, the runtime takes into account only the managed memory, and thus underestimates the urgency of scheduling garbage collection. 方法通知运行时在系统内存，此额外的压力和方法将通知运行时已释放额外的压力。The method informs the runtime of this additional pressure on system memory, and the method informs the runtime that the additional pressure has been released. 在最简单的使用情况模式中，托管的对象分配构造函数中的非托管的内存和释放在`Dispose`或`Finalize`方法。In the simplest usage pattern, a managed object allocates unmanaged memory in the constructor and releases it in the `Dispose` or `Finalize` method. 调用方法之后分配非托管的内存中，并调用方法之后将其释放。Call the method after allocating the unmanaged memory, and call the method after releasing it. 在更复杂的情况下，其中的非托管的内存分配非常大的变化的托管对象的生存期内，可以调用和方法进行通信的运行时对这些增量更改。In more complicated scenarios, where the unmanaged memory allocation changes substantially during the lifetime of the managed object, you can call the and methods to communicate these incremental changes to the runtime. > [!CAUTION] > 你必须确保删除完全您添加的压力量。You must ensure that you remove exactly the amount of pressure you add. 如果不这样做可能会较长时间的时间运行的应用程序中的系统的性能产生负面影响。Failing to do so can adversely affect the performance of the system in applications that run for long periods of time.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将添加`obj`参数的垃圾回收器释放对象前会请求终止的对象的列表。The method adds the `obj` parameter to the list of objects that request finalization before the garbage collector frees the object. `obj`参数必须是此方法的调用方。The `obj` parameter must be the caller of this method. 调用方法并不保证垃圾回收器将调用对象的终结器。Calling the method does not guarantee that the garbage collector will call an object's finalizer. 默认情况下，实现终结器的所有对象都添加到需要终止; 的对象的列表但是，对象可能已终止，或者可能已通过调用禁用终止方法。By default, all objects that implement finalizers are added to the list of objects that require finalization; however, an object might have already been finalized or might have disabled finalization by calling the method. 终结器可以使用此方法使重新起用自己或它所引用的对象。A finalizer can use this method to resurrect itself or an object that it references. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用 ReRegisterForFinalize 方法以完成第二个对象垃圾回收后的时间。The following example demonstrates how to use the ReRegisterForFinalize method to finalize an object a second time after garbage collection. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法的对象标头中该位设置设置`obj`，在调用终结器时将运行时检查。This method sets a bit in the object header of `obj`, which the runtime checks when calling finalizers. 终结器中，表示方法，用于在一个对象进行垃圾回收之前，释放非托管的资源。A finalizer, which is represented by the method, is used to release unmanaged resources before an object is garbage-collected. 如果`obj`没有终结器中，调用方法不起作用。If `obj` does not have a finalizer, the call to the method has no effect. 对象实现接口可以从对象的调用此方法实现以防止垃圾回收器调用对不需要它的对象。Objects that implement the interface can call this method from the object's implementation to prevent the garbage collector from calling on an object that does not require it. 通常情况下，这样做是为了防止终结器释放非托管的资源，已释放了实现。Typically, this is done to prevent the finalizer from releasing unmanaged resources that have already been freed by the implementation. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用在资源类，以防止从调用冗余垃圾回收中的方法。The following example demonstrates how to use the method in a resource class to prevent a redundant garbage collection from being called. 该示例使用[释放模式](~/docs/standard/design-guidelines/dispose-pattern.md)同时释放托管资源 (即对象实现) 和非托管资源。The example uses the [dispose pattern](~/docs/standard/design-guidelines/dispose-pattern.md) to free both managed resources (that is, objects that implement ) and unmanaged resources. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法尝试将垃圾回收器放在应用程序执行代码的关键区域的同时，不允许垃圾回收无 GC 区域延迟模式。The method attempts to place the garbage collector in no GC region latency mode, which disallows garbage collection while an app executes a critical region of code. 如果无法最初分配请求的内存量运行时，垃圾回收器尝试释放更多的内存中执行完整的阻碍性垃圾回收。If the runtime is unable to initially allocate the requested amount of memory, the garbage collector performs a full blocking garbage collection in an attempt to free additional memory. 垃圾回收器进入无 GC 区域延迟模式，如果无法分配所需的数量的内存，在这种情况下为实际 2 \*`totalSize`字节 (它将尝试分配`totalSize`小对象堆的字节数和`totalSize`的字节数大型对象堆）。The garbage collector enters no GC region latency mode if it is able to allocate the required amount of memory, which in this case is actually 2 \* `totalSize` bytes (it attempts to allocate `totalSize` bytes for the small object heap and `totalSize` bytes for the large object heap). `totalSize` 必须足够大，以处理在关键路径中发生的所有内存分配。`totalSize` must be large enough to handle all memory allocations that occur in the critical path. 这包括分配的应用程序中，以及运行时使应用程序的代表的分配。This includes allocations by the app, as well as allocations that the runtime makes on the app's behalf. > [!IMPORTANT] > 无法将调用传给方法，并且你应只调用方法如果运行时当前处于无 GC 区域延迟模式。You cannot nest calls to the method, and you should only call the method if the runtime is currently in no GC region latency mode. 换而言之，不应调用多次 （在第一个方法调用后，后续调用将不会成功），并且不应需要调用成功只是因为第一次调用到成功。In other words, you should not call multiple times (after the first method call, subsequent calls will not succeed), and you should not expect calls to to succeed just because the first call to succeeded. 通过调用退出无 GC 区域延迟模式方法。You exit the no GC region latency mode by calling the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法尝试将垃圾回收器放在应用程序执行代码的关键区域的同时，不允许垃圾回收无 GC 区域延迟模式。The method attempts to place the garbage collector in no GC region latency mode, which disallows garbage collection while an app executes a critical region of code. 如果运行时无法最初分配请求的内存量和`disallowFullBlockingGC`自变量是`false`，垃圾回收器执行完整的阻碍性垃圾回收中尝试释放更多内存; 否则为分配将失败，并且该方法返回`false`。If the runtime is unable to initially allocate the requested amount of memory and the `disallowFullBlockingGC` argument is `false`, the garbage collector performs a full blocking garbage collection in an attempt to free additional memory; otherwise, the allocation fails, and the method returns `false`. 垃圾回收器进入无 GC 区域延迟模式，如果无法分配所需的数量的内存，在这种情况下为实际 2 \* `totalSize` (它将尝试分配`totalSize`针对小型对象堆和`totalSize`大型对象堆）。The garbage collector enters no GC region latency mode if it is able to allocate the required amount of memory, which in this case is actually 2 \* `totalSize` (it attempts to allocate `totalSize` for the small object heap and `totalSize` for the large object heap). `totalSize` 必须足够大，以处理在关键路径中发生的所有内存分配。`totalSize` must be large enough to handle all memory allocations that occur in the critical path. 这包括分配的应用程序中，以及运行时使应用程序的代表的分配。This includes allocations by the app, as well as allocations that the runtime makes on the app's behalf. 设置`disallowFullBlockingGC`到`true`以防止完整的阻碍性垃圾回收集合最初可用没有足够的内存是否是在负载平衡方案中最有用： 一个系统可以调用此方法，并报告本身为准备好接受请求，如果它返回`true`，并且具有负载平衡器将请求重定向到其他系统，如果它返回`false`。Setting `disallowFullBlockingGC` to `true` to prevent a full blocking garbage collection if not enough memory is initially available is most useful in load balancing scenarios: one system can call this method and report itself as ready to accept requests if it returns `true`, and have the load balancer redirect requests to other systems if it returns `false`. 它可以进行完整的阻碍性垃圾回收时不处理请求通过调用方法。It can then do a full blocking garbage collection when it's not handling requests by calling the method. > [!IMPORTANT] > 无法将调用传给方法，并且你应只调用方法如果运行时当前处于无 GC 区域延迟模式。You cannot nest calls to the method, and you should only call the method if the runtime is currently in no GC region latency mode. 换而言之，不应调用多次 （在第一个方法调用后，后续调用将不会成功），并且不应需要调用成功只是因为第一次调用到成功。In other words, you should not call multiple times (after the first method call, subsequent calls will not succeed), and you should not expect calls to to succeed just because the first call to succeeded. 通过调用退出无 GC 区域延迟模式方法。You exit the no GC region latency mode by calling the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法尝试将垃圾回收器放在应用程序执行代码的关键区域的同时，不允许垃圾回收无 GC 区域延迟模式。The method attempts to place the garbage collector in no GC region latency mode, which disallows garbage collection while an app executes a critical region of code. 如果运行时无法最初分配请求的内存量和`disallowFullBlockingGC`自变量是`false`，垃圾回收器执行完整的阻碍性垃圾回收中尝试释放更多内存; 否则为分配将失败，并且该方法返回`false`。If the runtime is unable to initially allocate the requested amount of memory and the `disallowFullBlockingGC` argument is `false`, the garbage collector performs a full blocking garbage collection in an attempt to free additional memory; otherwise, the allocation fails, and the method returns `false`. 垃圾回收器进入无 GC 区域延迟模式，如果能够分配`lohSize`为 LOH 和`totalSize`–`lohSize`针对小型对象堆 (SOH)。The garbage collector enters no GC region latency mode if it is able to allocate `lohSize` for the LOH and `totalSize` – `lohSize` for the small object heap (SOH). `lohSize` 必须具有足够大小以处理有关 LOH，发生在关键路径中的所有内存分配和`totalSize`–`lohSize`必须足够大，无法都处理的 SOH 发生在关键路径中的所有内存分配。`lohSize` must be large enough to handle all memory allocations that occur in the critical path for the LOH, and `totalSize` – `lohSize` must be large enough to handle all memory allocations that occur in the critical path for the SOH. 这包括分配的应用程序中，以及运行时使应用程序的代表的分配。This includes allocations by the app, as well as allocations that the runtime makes on the app's behalf. 设置`disallowFullBlockingGC`到`true`以防止完整的阻碍性垃圾回收集合最初可用没有足够的内存是否是在负载平衡方案中最有用： 一个系统可以调用此方法，并报告本身为准备好接受请求，如果它返回`true`，并且具有负载平衡器将请求重定向到其他系统，如果它返回`false`。Setting `disallowFullBlockingGC` to `true` to prevent a full blocking garbage collection if not enough memory is initially available is most useful in load balancing scenarios: one system can call this method and report itself as ready to accept requests if it returns `true`, and have the load balancer redirect requests to other systems if it returns `false`. 它可以进行完整的阻碍性垃圾回收时不处理请求通过调用方法。It can then do a full blocking garbage collection when it's not handling requests by calling the method. > [!IMPORTANT] > 无法将调用传给方法，并且你应只调用方法如果运行时当前处于无 GC 区域延迟模式。You cannot nest calls to the method, and you should only call the method if the runtime is currently in no GC region latency mode. 换而言之，不应调用多次 （在第一个方法调用后，后续调用将不会成功），并且不应需要调用成功只是因为第一次调用到成功。In other words, you should not call multiple times (after the first method call, subsequent calls will not succeed), and you should not expect calls to to succeed just because the first call to succeeded. 通过调用退出无 GC 区域延迟模式方法。You exit the no GC region latency mode by calling the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用返回此方法以确定当前已由使用注册的垃圾回收通知的状态的枚举方法。Use the enumeration returned by this method to determine the status of the current garbage collection notification that was registered by using the method. 你还可以使用方法来确定完整的垃圾回收是否已完成。You can also use the method to determine whether the full garbage collection has completed. 当在枚举返回，你可以执行任务，例如阻止分配和使用自行引发回收其他对象方法。When the enumeration returns , you can do tasks such as preventing additional objects from being allocated and inducing a collection yourself with the method. 请注意通知不保证完整的垃圾回收会发生，仅保证条件已达到阈值，支持完整垃圾回收发生。Note that the notification does not guarantee that a full garbage collection will occur, only that conditions have reached the threshold that are favorable for a full garbage collection to occur. 无限期地等待垃圾回收通知要从中获取此方法。This method waits indefinitely for a garbage collection notification to be obtained. 如果你想要指定要返回如果无法获得通知的方法的超时期限，使用方法重载。If you want to specify a time-out period for the method to return if the notification cannot be obtained, use the method overload. 如果不指定超时情况下调用此方法，则可以调用如果你在等待时间超过首选的方法。If you call this method without specifying a time-out, you can call the method if you are waiting longer than preferred. 你应遵循通过调用此方法方法以确保已进行过完整的垃圾回收。You should follow this method with a call to the method to make sure that you have had a full garbage collection. 单独调用此方法会导致不确定结果。Calling this method alone causes indeterminate results. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用此方法来确定是否正在接近的完整、 阻碍性垃圾回收。The following example shows how to use this method to determine whether a full, blocking garbage collection is approaching. 每当通知的状态是，用户方法`OnFullGCApproachNotify`调用以执行操作以响应接近的集合。Whenever the status of the notification is , the user method `OnFullGCApproachNotify` is called to perform actions in response to the approaching collection. 此代码示例摘自更大的示例为提供[垃圾回收通知](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/notifications.md)主题。This code example is part of a larger example provided for [Garbage Collection Notifications](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/notifications.md) topic. remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用返回此方法以确定当前已由使用注册的垃圾回收通知的状态的枚举方法。Use the enumeration returned by this method to determine the status of the current garbage collection notification that was registered by using the method. 你还可以使用方法来确定是否即将引发完整的垃圾回收。You can also use the method to determine whether a full garbage collection is imminent. 当在枚举返回，你可以执行任务，例如继续处理并获取集合计数与属性。When the enumeration returns , you can do tasks such as resuming work and obtaining a collection count with the property. 无限期地等待垃圾回收通知要从中获取此方法。This method waits indefinitely for a garbage collection notification to be obtained. 如果你想要指定要返回如果无法获得通知的方法的超时期限，使用方法重载。If you want to specify a time-out period for the method to return if the notification cannot be obtained, use the method overload. 如果不指定超时情况下调用此方法，则可以调用如果你在等待时间超过首选的方法。If you call this method without specifying a time-out, you can call the method if you are waiting longer than preferred. 此方法调用之前应该通过调用方法以确保已进行过完整的垃圾回收。This method call should be preceded with a call to the method to make sure that you have had a full garbage collection. 单独调用此方法可能产生不确定结果。Calling this method alone can produce indeterminate results. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用此方法来确定完整的垃圾回收是否已完成。The following example shows how to use this method to determine whether a full garbage collection has completed. 每当通知的状态是，用户方法`OnFullGCCompletedNotify`调用以执行操作以响应已完成的集合。Whenever the status of the notification is , the user method `OnFullGCCompletedNotify` is called to perform actions in response to the completed collection. 此代码示例摘自更大的示例为提供[垃圾回收通知](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/notifications.md)主题。This code example is part of a larger example provided for [Garbage Collection Notifications](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/notifications.md) topic. summary.span: Suspends the current thread until the thread that is processing the queue of finalizers has emptied that queue.

span.span: Suspends the current thread until the thread that is processing the queue of finalizers has emptied that queue.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当垃圾回收器发现可以回收的对象时，它会检查以确定对象的终止要求每个对象。When the garbage collector finds objects that can be reclaimed, it checks each object to determine the object's finalization requirements. 如果对象实现终结器，并通过调用未禁用终止，该对象被放置在标记为准备好进行终结的对象的列表。If an object implements a finalizer and has not disabled finalization by calling , the object is placed in a list of objects that are marked as ready for finalization. 垃圾回收器调用此列表和中移除这些项从列表中的对象的方法。The garbage collector calls the methods for the objects in this list and removes the entries from the list. 此方法阻止，直到所有的终结器已完成运行。This method blocks until all finalizers have run to completion. 对其运行的终结器线程未指定，因此不能保证此方法将终止。The thread on which finalizers are run is unspecified, so there is no guarantee that this method will terminate. 但是，可以由其他线程时中断此线程方法正在进行。However, this thread can be interrupted by another thread while the method is in progress. 例如，你可以等待一段时间内，如果此线程仍然挂起则中断此线程的另一个线程。For example, you can start another thread that waits for a period of time and then interrupts this thread if this thread is still suspended. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用方法挂起当前线程，直到终止所有收集的对象的已完成。The following example demonstrates how to use the method to suspend the current thread until finalization of all the collected objects is complete. [!code-cpp[System.GC.WaitForPendingFinalizers Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.GC.WaitForPendingFinalizers Example/CPP/class1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.GC.WaitForPendingFinalizers Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.GC.WaitForPendingFinalizers Example/CS/class1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.GC.WaitForPendingFinalizers Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.GC.WaitForPendingFinalizers Example/VB/class1.vb#1)]
